sen.j: 藩士（はんし）は、江戸時代の各藩に仕えた武士に対する呼称。
sen.e: "Hanshi" is the name for samurai who served each domain in Edo period.
Hanshi were samurai who served Edo period domains.
Hanshi were samurai who served Edo period clans.

sen.j: ただ、一概に藩士といっても、上士から下士まであり、また、厳密には武士以外にも足軽や中間といったいわゆる士分格ではない者も含まれてる。
sen.e: However Hanshi include all samurai ranging from Joshi (superior warriors) to noncommissioned officers, and in a precise sense, they also include people who are not in samurai status such as ashigaru (common foot soldiers) and chugen (a rank below common soldiers).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However Hanshi include all samurai ranging from Joshi (superior warriors) to non-commissioned officers, and in a narrow sense, they also include those without samurai status such as ashigaru (common foot soldiers) and chugen (a rank below common soldiers).

However Hanshi include all samurai ranging from Joshi (superior warriors) to Kashi (non-commissioned officers), and in a narrow sense, they also include those without samurai status such as ashigaru (common foot soldiers) and chugen (a rank below common soldiers).
sen.cmt: 前後の用語と合わせて読みを補足しました。

sen.j: その為、藩士＝武士というのは間違いであるとすることがある。
sen.e: Therefore it may be said that hanshi are not always samurai.

sen.e: Therefore it may be said that hanshi are not necessarily samurai.

sen.j: つまり藩籍を有する者全てを指す方が正しいとする説がある。
sen.e: In other words, it may be correct to say that the Hanshi represents all people who own Hanseki (registers for domains).
In other words, it may be correct to say that the Hanshi refers to all people who owned Hanseki (domain registers).

sen.e: But in many cases it represnets samurai classes.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期は、軍役を担う兵としての要素が強かったが、中期後期になると次第に官僚、役人としての意味合いが強くなった。
sen.e: Although they mainly worked as soldiers playing roles in military services early in Edo period, their work gradually shifted and became more like as the bureaucracy or government officials in the middle and the late part of Edo period.

Although they mainly served as soldiers playing military roles during the early in Edo period, they gradually became bureaucrats and lost most of their military function during the mid-to-late Edo period.

sen.j: ちなみに江戸時代は、藩士が自らのことを藩士と呼ぶことはなかった。
sen.e: In passing, they didn't call themselves Hanshi in Edo period.
They were not called "Hanshi" during the Edo period.
In fact, they didn't call themselves Hanshi during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせて表現を変えました。

sen.j: 例えば、薩摩藩の藩士なら自らのことを「薩摩藩藩士誰々」と名乗るのではなく「島津家家臣誰々」と名乗った。
sen.e: For example, Hanshi in Satsuma Domain called themselves 'a vassal of Shimazu Family, so-and-so' rather than 'a Hanshi in Satsuma Domain, so-and-so'.
For example, the names of Hanshi in the Satsuma Domain preceded by 'Shimazu Family Retainer' as opposed to 'Satsuma Domain Retainer.'

sen.j: もっとも薩摩藩や長州藩のように初代藩主以来、明治時代の廃藩置県まで国替えがなかった藩の場合は「藩士」の呼称でも通用する。
sen.e: The name 'Hanshi' is valid to be used in the domains which had no transferences between domains from the days of the first lords till Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in Meiji period such as Satsuma Domain and Choshu Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The name 'Hanshi' is also commonly used in the case of domains, such as the Satsuma Domain and Choshu Domain, which had not come under provincial rule the time of the first lord until the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) in the Meiji period.

sen.j: しかし、桑名藩のように藩主家自体が江戸幕府の命で国替えしている藩では「藩士」の呼称がかならずしも妥当とは言い難い場合もある。
sen.e: However it isn't quite valid in the domains which the lords' families transferred their domains under the orders of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) such as Kuwana Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the term is not appropriate for domains, such as the Kuwana Domain, of which the lord family itself came under provincial rule as a result of orders from the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
